intro: Peiranisia orcuttii, commonly known as the Orcutt's peiranisia, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and umbrella-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and extreme temperatures. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
